author: Special Correspondent
text:
Taking cognisance of a CBI charge sheet, a Delhi court on Monday summoned the former Minister of State for Coal, Dilip Ray, as an accused in a coal block allocation scam case.

Mr. Ray was the Coal Minister in the Atal Bihari Vajpayee Cabinet in 1999.

Special Judge Bharat Parashar also summoned Pradip Kumar Banerjee, then Additional Secretary, and Nitya Nand Gautam, then adviser (projects) in the Ministry, and Castron Technologies Ltd. director Mahendra Kumar Agarwalla as accused in the case. The court asked them to appear on February 26.

Brahmadiha block

The case pertains to the allocation of the Brahmadiha coal block in Giridih in Jharkhand to Castron Technologies Ltd in 1999 in an illegal manner.

The court summoned them under Sections 120-B (criminal conspiracy), 420 (cheating) and 409 (criminal breach of trust) of the IPC and under the provisions of the Prevention of Corruption Act.

Prima facie evidence

Stating that there was prima facie enough evidence to summon them as accused in the case, the court said: “Public servants actively connived with private parties to facilitate misappropriation of nationalised natural resources by them.”

Dilip Ray was Coal Minister in Vajpayee Cabinet in 1999
title: Former Minister summoned in coal block case
